The mission of Webmainland Media Ltd is to bridge the inclusion gap between the Canadian local community and Chinese newcomers and immigrants. Chinese immigrants and newcomers can easily find their matched rental home and start their new life through the help of AI enabled community aide.
Our solutions speed up the social inclusion process for all community stakeholders. Newcomers do not need to take as long as 10 years to gain locality and feel belonged. New homeowners not just only own property, but also thrive in their communities. Locals get to know and connect with people who speak different languages and obtain opportunities to grow their businesses. Together, we create new neighbourhoods.
The Why
With the growing immigrant population and the need for diversity and inclusion, one pressing issue is the lack of connection channels between local communities and newcomers. Moreover, because of the language barrier and cultural differences, local communities cannot serve customers if they don't fully understand. In addition, the process of providing local community resources and benefits to the Chinese community/new immigrants is mostly made manually, which is very inefficient and limiting.
The R&D

In the beginning, we build the RealtorAccess platform which allows realtors to engage with the local Chinese community and deliver their expertise directly from their desktops.

It is a smart social connector where neighbours are introduced to curated group gatherings to gain community updates, peer supports, matched English practice partners and diverse community resources. The Linli experience accelerates users' social integration process.
In light of the growing population of Chinese newcomers and the housing crisis, we have developed an AI-enabled community settlement aide solution, which connect newcomers with landlords to find their rental homes.
What makes Webmainland’s neighbourhood engagement experience unique is that we utilize local realtors' connections and expertise. Therefore, data is gathered, organized, and aggregated into a unified neighbourhoods database. The Natural Language Processing team in the Ai division of Dialpad analyzes customer voice and digital engagements to provide linguistic insights of business value. We build natural language understanding modules to enhance and streamline business communications, including sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, information extraction, intent detection, question answering and text summarization. We build our own state-of-the-art solutions using a mixture of in-house and open source technologies ranging from knowledge-engineered solutions to the very latest deep learning transformer models, while carefully considering the ethical impact of our research.
We're an eclectic group of scientists, with backgrounds in diverse fields including linguistics, computational linguistics, machine learning, computer science, materials science, biology, and quantum physics. And we work in a mix of tools and technologies - Python and Pytorch mostly, but some Keras, Tensorflow, and miscellaneous programming languages to keep things varied.
Your role
As an Applied Scientist, you will research, experiment and build natural language understanding modules to enhance business communications. You'll work closely with product engineers, designers, data engineers, data analysts, automatic speech recognition scientists, digital engagement engineers and a data annotation team. We build innovative product features based on sound science. We encourage our team members to publish and participate in academic conferences such as SIGIR, ACL, and EMNLP. You can get a flavor for the work of the team from our blog posts:
https://www.dialpad.com/blog/category/dialpad-ai/
https://towardsdatascience.com/tagged/dialpad
This position reports to our Manager of Applied Science. Most of the team is based in the Vancouver and Kitchener area, but we're open to remote work from within Canada or the USA.
What you'll do
In your first 30 days:
You'll work closely with your manager and an onboarding buddy to learn our technical infrastructure and our linguistic domain
Working with your buddy, you'll dig into our data and begin to make some modifications to code for extracting a linguistic "moment". This will get you familiar with how we develop and deploy our features. Recent projects that new hires took on during their first 30 days include flagging personally identifiable information in transcripts, formatting and extracting postal codes, and experimenting with data augmentation methods to improve a sequence labeling model
You'll attend the weekly learning seminars that our team and the speech recognition team runs to discuss the latest research on our team, papers hot off arXiv, or interesting conferences
In your first 60 days:
You'll take on a task in collaboration with another colleague. You'll do the data exploration, maybe build a prototype, and write up an experiment plan
You'll meet with our product managers to discuss how these ideas fit with the overall product, and brainstorm with UI designers about what the feature might look like in the product
You'll be invited to give an internal presentation to the other scientists about some area that interests you at one of the learning sessions
You'll spend a lot of time iterating on experiments. We try to make sure scientists and software developers have lots of meeting-free time to focus on the fun bits of the job
In your first 90 days:
You'll see your first major project move through the stages of internal deployment then into production. There's usually a period of tuning and refining when we see how things operate at scale
You'll participate in the team's brainstorming sessions as we plan for the quarter and year ahead
You might attend a conference on machine learning or computational linguistics

THE POSITION
The role of the Data Scientist is to be a key strategic partner to the BI Canada Human Pharma division, providing customer and patient insights using advanced analytics techniques. The data scientist uses a variety of data sources to assess the impact of individual campaigns, campaign mixtures, predict future performance, evaluate strategies, and drive a continuously improving customer experience. The data scientist is a proactive, self motivated individual who upskills the business on how emerging machine learning and AI models can be applied to advance our complex business scenarios.
Responsibilities
Provide specialized business performance analysis including (but not limited to): statistical assessments, dynamic forecasting, lifetime value prediction of customers, to provide actionable recommendations for changes in customer strategies and to support the continuing digital transformation of the BI HP organization. Foster strong working relationships with key counterparts in Customer eXperience Operations (eg market researchers, forecasters, business intelligence specialists), corporate digital transformation team (OneTeam) and the global data science team to ensure that all relevant information is incorporated, and that outputs are clear for internal customers.
Continue delivery of established models including customer lifetime digital value, patient dropoff prediction, prescriber trend detection, territory level sales prediction, and customer channel impact assessment, while also developing new models including non-DLD trend prediction, product LOE planning, etc.
Partner in transitioning and maintaining Canadian advanced analytics to new global AWS environment, ensuring all models are appropriately migrated. Ensure "data cleaning" algorithms for patient support, email, and web datasets are executing in both the legacy and new systems.
Gain a deep understanding of the business and information needs of the multi-functional team, and lead the team in solving critical business issues through scoping and hypotheses development supported by CXO. Rapidly perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, and uncover interesting trends and relationships. Analyze and model structured data and implement algorithms to support analysis using advanced statistical and mathematical methods from statistics and data mining. Research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes. Serve as the Analytics data science expert, through active participation with OneTeam global and local teams, and provide insight based presentations to product ICP teams and communication that guide decisions affecting the product/therapeutic area strategy. Take complex data and analytics from these analyses and communicate in a way that is understandable and relatable to the audience
Uncover/identify new and innovative techniques and methodologies that bring leading edge innovation to BI business analytics and the resulting strategy development. Partner with BI Incubator team and external agencies such as Vector Institute to create thought leadership in this area.

Minimum 5 years of experience in an analytical business function
